title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
9–6: Stronger

  • Has a clear, well-developed thesis.

  • Is well organized.

  • Addresses the terms of the question.

  • Supports the thesis with specific evidence.

  • May contain minor errors; even a 9 need not be flawless.

Indicators

  1. Discusses treatment of Germany after both the First and Second World Wars using specific supporting evidence.

  2. Describes both similarities and differences in treatment; one area may be more developed than the other.

  3. Develops at least one reason for similarities and/or differences; essays in the 9–8 range will develop more than one reason.

5–4 Mixed

  • Contains a thesis, perhaps superficial or simplistic.

  • Provides uneven response to the question’s terms.

  • May contain errors, factual or interpretive.

Indicators

  1. Discusses treatment of Germany after both the First and Second World Wars but does so with limited supporting evidence.

  2. May focus only on one aspect of compare/contrast OR offer only superficial treatment.

  3. Offers superficial or vague reasons for similarities and differences in treatment.

3–0: Weaker

(Essays scored 1 or 0 may attempt to address the question but fail to do so.)

  • Thesis is confused, or absent, or merely restates the question.

  • Misconstrues the question or omits major tasks.

  • May contain major errors.

Indicators

  1. May contain little or no supporting evidence about treatment of Germany following one or both of the wars.

  2. May ignore the compare/contrast aspect of the question entirely.

  3. Offers little or no explanation of reasons for the similarities and differences in treatment.
